009package Hough_Transform.lib;
010
011import java.awt.Point;
012import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.pub.hough.lines.HoughLine;
021
022
023/**
024 * This class implements the "classic" Hough Transform for straight lines.
025 * This implementation improves the algorithm described in the textbook in
026 * the way the accumulator is updated. Here, the quantity 1 is not added
027 * to a single accumulator cell but gets distributed over two neighboring
028 * (radial) cells to reduce aliasing effects. Thus we accumulate non-integer
029 * values and therefore the various accumulators are of type {@code float[][]}.
030 *
031 * 
032 * TODO: add bias correction
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2018/12/04
036 */
037public class HoughTransformLines2 {
038
039        public static class Parameters {
040                /** Number of angular steps over [0, pi] */
041                public int nAng = 256;
042                /** Number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction (accum. size = 2 * nRad + 1) */
043                public int nRad = 128;
044                public boolean showProgress = true;
045                public boolean showCheckImage = true;
046                public boolean debug = false;
047        }
048
049        private final Parameters params;
050
051        private final int nAng; // number of angular steps over [0, pi]
052        private final int nRad; // number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction
053
054        private final int width, height; // size of the reference frame (image)
055        private final double xRef, yRef; // reference point (x/y-coordinate of image center)
056
057        private final double dAng; // increment of angle
058        private final double dRad; // increment of radius
059        private final int cRad; // array index representing the zero radius
060
061        private final int accWidth; // width of the accumulator array (angular direction)
062        private final int accHeight; // height of the accumulator array (radial direction)
063        private final float[][] accumulator; // accumulator array
064        private final float[][] accumulatorExt; // extended accumulator array
065        private final float[][] accumulatorMax; // accumulator, with local maxima only
066        
067        private final List<Point>[][] accumulatorBacklinks;
068
069        private final double[] cosTable; // tabulated cosine values
070        private final double[] sinTable; // tabulated sine values
071
072        // -------------- public constructor(s) ------------------------
073
074        /**
075         * Creates a new Hough transform from the image I.
076         * 
077         * @param I      input image, relevant (edge) points have pixel values greater 0.
078         * @param params parameter object.
079         */
080        public HoughTransformLines2(ImageProcessor I, Parameters params) {
081                this(I.getWidth(), I.getHeight(), params);
082                process(I, accumulator);
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Creates a new Hough transform from a sequence of 2D points. Parameters M, N
087         * are only used to specify the reference point (usually at the center of the
088         * image). Use this constructor if the relevant image points are collected
089         * separately.
090         * 
091         * @param points an array of 2D points.
092         * @param width      width of the corresponding image plane.
093         * @param height      height of the corresponding image plane.
094         * @param params parameter object.
095         */
096        public HoughTransformLines2(Point2D[] points, int width, int height, Parameters params) {
097                this(width, height, params);
098                process(points, accumulator);
099        }
100
101        // Non-public constructor used by public constructors (to set up all final
102        // members variables).
103        private HoughTransformLines2(int width, int height, Parameters params) {
104                this.params = (params == null) ? new Parameters() : params;
105                this.width = width;
106                this.height = height;
107                this.xRef = width / 2; // integer value
108                this.yRef = height / 2; // integer value
109                this.nAng = params.nAng;
110                this.nRad = params.nRad;
111                this.dAng = Math.PI / nAng;
112                this.dRad = 0.5 * Math.sqrt(width * width + height * height) / nRad; // nRad radial steps over half the diagonal length
113                this.cRad = nRad;
114                this.accWidth = nAng;
115                this.accHeight = nRad + 1 + nRad;
116                this.accumulator = new float[accWidth][accHeight]; // cells are initialized to zero!
117                this.accumulatorExt = new float[2 * accWidth][accHeight];
118                this.accumulatorMax = new float[accWidth][accHeight];
119                this.cosTable = makeCosTable();
120                this.sinTable = makeSinTable();
121                
122                this.accumulatorBacklinks = makeAccumulatorBacklinks();
123        }
124        
125        private List<Point>[][] makeAccumulatorBacklinks() {
126                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
127                List<Point>[][] abl = new ArrayList[accWidth][accHeight];
128                for (int i = 0; i < accWidth; i++) {
129                        for (int j = 0; j < accHeight; j++) {
130                                abl[i][j] = new ArrayList<>();
131                        }
132                }
133                return abl;
134        }
135
136        // -------------- public methods ------------------------
137
138        /**
139         * Finds and returns the parameters of the strongest lines with a specified min.
140         * pixel count. All objects in the returned array are valid, but the array may
141         * be empty. Note: Could perhaps be implemented more efficiently with
142         * insert-sort.
143         * 
144         * @param amin the minimum accumulator value for each line.
145         * @param maxLines maximum number of (strongest) lines to extract.
146         * @return a possibly empty array of {@link HoughLine} objects.
147         */
148        public HoughLine[] getLines(int amin, int maxLines) {
149                makeAccumulatorExt();   // TODO: should not be here
150                findLocalMaxima();
151                // collect all lines corresponding to accumulator maxima
152                List<HoughLine> lines = new ArrayList<>();
153                for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
154                        for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
155                                int hcount = (int) accumulatorMax[ai][ri];
156                                if (hcount >= amin) {
157                                        double angle = angleFromIndex(ai);
158                                        double radius = radiusFromIndex(ri);
159                                        lines.add(new HoughLine(angle, radius, xRef, yRef, hcount));
160                                }
161                        }
162                }
163                // sort 'lines' by count (highest counts first)
164                Collections.sort(lines);
165                List<HoughLine> slines = lines.subList(0, Math.min(maxLines, lines.size()));
166                // convert the list to an array and return:
167                return slines.toArray(new HoughLine[0]);
168        }
169        
170        /**
171         * @return The reference point used by this Hough transform.
172         * @deprecated
173         */
174        public Point2D getReferencePoint() {
175                return new Point2D.Double(xRef, yRef);
176        }
177        
178        public double getXref() {
179                return xRef;
180        }
181        
182        public double getYref() {
183                return yRef;
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * Calculates the actual angle (in radians) for angle index {@code ai}
188         * 
189         * @param ai angle index [0,...,nAng-1]
190         * @return Angle [0,...,PI] for angle index ai
191         */
192        public double angleFromIndex(int ai) {
193                return ai * dAng;
194        }
195
196        /**
197         * Calculates the actual radius for radius index ri.
198         * 
199         * @param ri radius index [0,...,nRad-1].
200         * @return Radius [-maxRad,...,maxRad] with respect to reference point (xc, yc).
201         */
202        public double radiusFromIndex(int ri) {
203                return (ri - cRad) * dRad;
204        }
205
206        public double radiusToIndex(double rad) {
207                return cRad + rad / dRad;
208        }
209        
210        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
211
212        /**
213         * Returns the accumulator as a 2D float-array.
214         * @return the contents of the accumulator
215         */
216        public float[][] getAccumulator() {
217                return this.accumulator;
218        }
219
220        /**
221         * Returns the local maximum values of the accumulator as a 2D float-array
222         * (all non-maximum elements are set to zero).
223         * @return the local maximum values of the accumulator 
224         */
225        public float[][] getAccumulatorMax() {
226                return this.accumulatorMax;
227        }
228        
229        /**
230         * Returns the extended accumulator as a 2D float-array.
231         * @return the extended accumulator
232         */
233        public float[][] getAccumulatorExtended() {
234                return this.accumulatorExt;
235        }
236        
237
238        /**
239         * Creates and returns an image of the 2D accumulator array.
240         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator
241         */
242        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImage() {
243                return new FloatProcessor(accumulator);
244        }
245        
246
247        /**
248         * Creates and returns an image of the extended 2D accumulator array, produced
249         * by adding a vertically mirrored copy of the accumulator to its right end. 
250         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the extended accumulator
251         */
252        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImageExtended() {
253                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(accumulatorExt);
254                return fp;
255        }
256
257        /**
258         * Creates and returns an image of the local maxima of the 2D accumulator array.
259         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator maxima
260         */
261        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorMaxImage() {
262                return new FloatProcessor(accumulatorMax);
263        }
264
265        // -------------- nonpublic methods ------------------------
266
267        private double[] makeCosTable() {
268                double[] cosTab = new double[nAng];
269                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
270                        double angle = dAng * ai;
271                        cosTab[ai] = Math.cos(angle);
272                }
273                return cosTab;
274        }
275
276        private double[] makeSinTable() {
277                double[] sinTab = new double[nAng];
278                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
279                        double angle = dAng * ai;
280                        sinTab[ai] = Math.sin(angle);
281                }
282                return sinTab;
283        }
284
285        private void process(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] acc) {
286                if (params.showProgress)
287                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
288                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
289                        if (params.showProgress)
290                                IJ.showProgress(v, height);
291                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
292                                if ((0xFFFFFF & ip.get(u, v)) != 0) { // this is a foreground (edge) pixel - use ImageAccessor??
293                                        processPoint(u, v, acc);
294                                }
295                        }
296                }
297                if (params.showProgress)
298                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
299        }
300
301        private void process(Point2D[] points, float[][] acc) {
302                if (params.showProgress)
303                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
304                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
305                        if (params.showProgress && i % 50 == 0)
306                                IJ.showProgress(i, points.length);
307                        Point2D p = points[i];
308                        if (p != null) {
309                                processPoint(p.getX(), p.getY(), acc);
310                        }
311                }
312                if (params.showProgress)
313                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
314        }
315
316        private void processPoint(double u, double v, float[][] acc) {
317                final double x = u - xRef;
318                final double y = v - yRef;
319                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
320//                      double theta = dAng * ai;
321//                      double r = x * Math.cos(theta) + y * Math.sin(theta);
322                        double r = x * cosTable[ai] + y * sinTable[ai]; // sin/cos tables improve speed!
323                        double ri = radiusToIndex(r);
324                        // accumulated quantity (1.0) is distributed to 2 neighboring bins:
325                        int r0 = (int) Math.floor(ri);  // lower radial bin index
326                        int r1 = r0 + 1;                                // upper radial bin index
327                        if (r0 >= 0 && r1 < accHeight) {
328                                double alpha = ri - r0;                 // balanced insertion
329                                acc[ai][r0] += (1.0 - alpha);
330                                acc[ai][r1] += alpha;
331                                
332                                // for testing only
333                                Point p = new Point((int)u, (int)v);    // register contributing image points
334                                accumulatorBacklinks[ai][r0].add(p);
335                                accumulatorBacklinks[ai][r1].add(p);
336                        }
337                }
338        }
339        
340        /**
341         * Searches for local maxima in the extended accumulator but enters their
342         * positions in 'accumulatorMax'.
343         */
344        private void findLocalMaxima() {
345                if (params.showProgress)
346                        IJ.showStatus("finding local maxima");
347                int count = 0;
348                for (int ai = 1; ai <= accWidth; ai++) {        // note the range!
349                        for (int ri = 1; ri < accHeight - 1; ri++) {
350                                float vC = accumulatorExt[ai][ri];      // center value
351                                boolean ismax = 
352                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri]     && // 0
353                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri - 1] && // 1
354                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri - 1] && // 2
355                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri - 1] && // 3
356                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri]     && // 4
357                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri + 1] && // 5
358                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri + 1] && // 6
359                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri + 1];   // 7
360                                if (ismax) {
361                                        if (ai < accWidth)
362                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][ri] = vC; // take care of ai == accWidth
363                                        else
364                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][accHeight - ri - 1] = vC;
365                                        count++;
366                                }
367                        }
368                }
369                if (params.debug)
370                        IJ.log("found maxima: " + count);
371        }
372        
373        /**
374         * Creates the extended 2D accumulator array 
375         */
376        private void makeAccumulatorExt() {
377                if (params.showProgress)
378                        IJ.showStatus("making extended accumulator");
379                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
380                        for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
381                                // insert original accumulator into the left side
382                                accumulatorExt[ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][ri];
383                                // insert a vertically flipped copy of accumulator into the right side
384                                accumulatorExt[accWidth + ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][accHeight - ri - 1];
385                        }
386                }
387        }
388        
389}
390
391
